summary: Interactive 2D map viewer with neon ray markers, implementing flipped Y-axis coordinate system for proper top-down image orientation
architectural_notes: Flipped Y-axis coordinate system: map center [1704, -961], extent [0, -1922, 3408, 0]
Neon ray markers positioned at [land.x, -land.y] to align with flipped image coordinates
Map physics: default zoom 2, range -1 to 5, free panning with seamless mode, no maxExtent constraint
ImageLayer configured with canvas renderer and anonymous cross-origin
UI layers: pointer-events: none on ray markers, close button at z-index 100

existing_features.title: Implement flipped Y-axis coordinate system in MapView: set map center to [1704, -961] and map extent to [0, -1922, 3408, 0] for proper top-down image orientation
Update ImageLayer extent configuration to [0, -1922, 3408, 0] and add canvas renderer with anonymous cross-origin support
Position neon ray UIMarkers using flipped coordinates: set position to [land.x, -land.y] to align with the flipped Y-axis coordinate system
Configure map physics: set default zoom to 2, minZoom to -1, maxZoom to 5, enable dragPan, disable dragPitch, and enable seamless mode to prevent bouncing
Remove maxExtent constraint from map options to allow free panning across the entire map area
Remove the green debug UI overlay from MapView component
Ensure close button has zIndex of 100 and set pointer-events to none on neon ray marker content (the ray div) to prevent blocking map dragging interactions
